text: Hello everyone.  I am middle age woman who had many directions in life from studying math to becoming a visual artist, stage director and actress. Recently I am self educating myself on programming and facing the problem that I feel a lot of people will be facing since getting into “knowing” what to do with a computer and in the computer is unavoidable. There is a need of thinking in more abstract terms that would allow learning through common logic of human mind rather than education done in unfamiliar to non-computer oriented mind language that describes another unknown language that talks to unknown and sometime “scary” beast - computer. Languages I have learn so far are Javascript, Elixir, Python, (html,css ), some Golang. While I am introducing myself to languages I am growing in understanding on difficulties and trying to bring into my mind solutions how things could be explained in more “human terms” and logic. I hope participating in this group will introduce new paths for people to cross the gap from not knowing into knowing what to do and how to approach computer programming.

Languages I have learn so far are Javascript, Elixir, Python, (html,css ), some Golang. While I am introducing myself to languages I am growing in understanding on difficulties and trying to bring into my mind solutions how things could be explained in more “human terms” and logic. I hope participating in this group will introduce new paths for people to cross the gap from not knowing into knowing what to do and how to approach computer programming.

text: <@UDCLT064X> That’s interesting! Typically what happens is the reverse (people going from curl to Postman because they couldn’t get curl to work). We also have a curl importer that tries to translate the command into a Postman request. Could you ask her to try that? Over the past 5 years of building Postman, I have realized that debugging an API call is actually a pretty hard problem with so many layers of technology involved. I read Mindstorms a while back and been trying to use that to guide users on how they can better understand what’s going on and peel these layers back.

text: I work making integrations between SaaS apps for buisness and use postman. My favorite feature is the share one as a person needs zero set up to get up and running. No back and forth phone calls and looking for curl typos or writing token acquire scripts.

text: <@UEASWGGMR> I’m actually constantly suggesting various pieces of software to her, but my suggestions tend to fall on deaf ears (she works remotely so I can’t just commandeer her laptop).  FWIW, I don’t think the issues in this particular case would have been solved by a curl importer. IIRC the first issue was that the curl command had been copy-pasted in a few places and somehow the straight quotation marks got transformed into curly quotation marks.
